page.title: 03School Uniform
page.content: Most primary schools in Northern Ireland, especially Belfast, have school uniforms. At Cabin Hill we all have to wear black shoes (we may wear sandals in the summer)and grey stockings with black and white stripes at the top. We wear shorts until we are twelve, when we are allowed to wear long grey trousers. We wear a white shirt,a tie,jumper and jacket, the tie being black and white stripes and the jacket and jumper grey. When we are coming to or going from school we wear a macintosh and a cap as well. For games we wear black or yellow cotton shirts, thin black shorts, black and white socks and either gym shoes or football boots. For cricket we wear a white shirt, black and white socks, gym shoes and ordinary grey shorts.
